title: James Bentley (rugby league)
text:
James Bentley (born ) is an <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Irish</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a or for <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
He played for the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>. Bentley has spent time on loan from <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">Saints</a> at the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> and the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Background.
Bentley was born in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire%2C%20England">West Yorkshire, England</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
James started his path towards a professional Rugby League career at Featherstone Rovers in the scholarship ranks after coming from nearby, Oulton Raiders. After his first season with the club, no game time and a change of coaching staff, he followed the fellow coaching staff to Bradford Bulls
Bradford Bulls.
Bentley came up through the Bradford Bulls academy and made his initial appearance for the Bradford Bulls in 2016 against the <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> in a pre season game and went on to make sporadic appearances throughout <a href="2016%20RFL%20Championship">2016</a>. Bentley cemented his place in the Bradford Bulls first team in <a href="2017%20RFL%20Championship">2017</a>. Despite the club's 12 point deduction, Bentley impressed scoring 18 tries. After the Bradford Bulls were relegated, Bentley signed for <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> side <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>.
St Helens.
At the end of the 2017 season Bentley signed a two-year deal with <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> side <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>. He joined the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> on <a href="Rugby%20League%20Dual%20registration">Rugby League Dual registration</a> in 2018 as part of a deal between the two clubs. He played for Sheffield against the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>.
He played in St Helens 8-4 <a href="2020%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2020 Super League Grand Final</a> victory over Wigan at the <a href="Kingston%20Communications%20Stadium">Kingston Communications Stadium</a> in Hull. He signed a one-year contract extension with St Helens for the 2021 season.
On 4 May 2021, he was ruled out for an indefinite period after suffering a badly broken leg.
Leeds Rhinos.
On 21 June 2021, it was reported that he had signed for <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>
Statistics.
Statistics do not include pre-season friendlies.
